thread.title: S.J. boys and girls: Forry sets Hammonton shutout record
thread.title_full: S.J. boys and girls: Forry sets Hammonton shutout record

title: S.J. boys and girls: Forry sets Hammonton shutout record
text:
Five of Forry's six saves came after Madison Chiola's goal in the first half.
Hammonton is slotted as the third seed in the South Jersey Group 3 playoffs. 
In other Tri-County Royal action: 
Camina Balmores, Lauren Hoelke, and Renae Moken scored a goal for Highland in a 3-1 victory over host Triton. 
Cape-Atlantic League. Jamie Hotter and Jenna Sayers scored in a 2-1 win for Mainland at Oakcrest. 
Summer Sides' second-half goal lifted host Middle Township over Absegami, 1-0. Krista Salvadore made six saves. 
Jordyn Martini scored in the second half of Egg Harbor Township's 1-0 win against visiting Millville. 
Jana Martini scored two goals for St. Joseph in a 5-2 win over visiting Buena. 
Tri-County Classic. Alexa Teschko scored on a pass from Jada Simon, and host Clayton beat Gloucester Catholic, 1-0. 
Annie Sanker scored a goal and had an assist for Pitman in a 4-0 defeat of visiting Salem. Hannah Derby, Emily Galvin, and Madison Quinn also scored. 
Nonleague. Victoria Bearden, Carly Dombrowski, and Amber Hickey scored goals in Maple Shade's 3-2 overtime win at Medford Tech. Field Hockey Nikki Santore scored her 99th, 100th, and 101st career goals as Eastern defeated Cherokee, 7-0, in an Olympic Conference match.
In other Olympic Conference play: 
Iris Schuck scored a hat trick for Washington Township in a 6-1 victory over visiting Lenape. Julia Patrone added two goals and Shannon Coghlan also scored. 
Tri-County Royal. Mackenzie Lafferty scored in the second half as host Triton defeated Highland, 1-0. 
Tri-County Classic. Olivia Amwake, Hannah Kehoe, and Brenna Lindner scored for Pitman in a 3-1 win over visiting Salem. 
Haylee Courant scored a goal and had an assist in a 2-0 win for host Gloucester against Glassboro. Emily Moran also scored. 
Colonial Conference. Nancia Holmes and Kortni Jackson scored goals in the first half for Paulsboro in a 2-1 win over host Overbrook. Brittany Willetts made seven saves. Boys' Soccer Northern Burlington senior Kyle Adams scored the equalizer and the winner in a 5-4 overtime victory over visiting Pennsauken.
Adams scored on a free kick from five yards out with three minutes left in regulation of the Burlington County League match. He later finished a pass from Matt Koller five minutes into overtime. 
Cape-Atlantic League. Joey DeLizza and J.J. Ellis scored for host Buena in a 2-1 overtime win against St. Joseph. 
Jose Contreras and Brinton Shinn netted two goals each in a 4-0 win for host Cedar Creek over Lower Cape May. 
Tri-County Classic. Will Helm and Dennis McAllister scored as Wildwood defeated visiting Gloucester, 2-1.
